transcript.title: FOR PRESS: P.M.NO 52/1968 VISIT BY THE EMPEROR OF ETHIOPIA
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS: P. M. L No. 52/ 1968.
VISIT BY THE EMPEROR OF ETIHIOPIA
As announced earlier by the Prime Minister, Mr. John
Gorton, His Imperial Majesty Haile Sellassie I of Ethiopia will visit
Australia from 13 to 17 May.
His Imperial Majesty, who is scheduled to arrive in
Canberra direct from Djakcarta at 4. 30 p. mn. on 13 May will be accompanied
by an official suite of 16. He will also visit Melbourne and Perth.
CANBERRA PROGRAMME
Monday, 13 May
Details of the programme for Canberra are as follows:
4. 30 p. m.
4. 43 p. m.
45 p. m.
7. 45 p. m.
9. 30 a. m.
9. 55 a. m.
00 a. m.
11. 30 a. m.
1.00 p. m.
4. 30 p. m.
8.00 p. m. Arrival at R. A. A. F. Fairbairn
Artillery salute 21 guns
Met by:
The Governor General
The Prime Minister
Inspects Guard of Honour
His Imperial Majesty and the Governor-General will leave
for Government House
The Prime Minister will make a formal call on His Imaperial
Maj esty
Dinner at Government House
Tuesday, 14 May
His Imperial Majesty visits the Australian W-7ar Memorial
and lays a wreath on the Stone of Remembrance. Visits
the 1-4a11 of M. emory and sigais the Visitois' Book.
Leaves for Parliament House
Discussions with Ministers of the Cabinet
The Governor-General presents to His Imperial Majesty
the Heads of Diplomatic Missions
Attends lunch given by the Australian Government. His
Imperial Majesty will reply to speeches of welcome
by Government and Opposition Leaders
Holds a Press Conference at Hotel Canberra
Dinner given by His Imperial Majesty at Canberra-Rex
Hotel / 2

" O 2.
Wednesday, 15 May
9. 20 a. m.
9. 50 a. m.
Please note: His Imperial Majesty and the Governor-General leave
Government House for R. A. A. F. Fairbairn
After inspecting the Guard of Honour and being farewelled
by the Governor-General and the Prime Minister, His
Imperial Majesty leaves for Melbourne
Melbourne and Perth
The Premiers of Victoria and Western Australia will each
announce details of the programme for Melbourne and
Perth.
CANBERRA 29 April 1968
